definition: askew/at a crooked angle/devious/noxious/(coll.) to lie on one's side

sentences.english: It ends with the words, "Was ever a thinker so travestied?"
sentences.chinese: 該書的最後說“有哪個思想家遭打如此歪曲？”

sentences.english: He ofter takes liberties with the truth.
Longevity is not distorted by self-report.
sentences.chinese: 長壽不受自我報告的歪曲。

sentences.english: This is a slanderous misrepresentation of our policy.
sentences.chinese: 這是對我們的政策的惡意歪曲。

sentences.english: The American model has also been seriously tarnished by the Bush administration's use of torture.
sentences.chinese: 布什政府的歪曲使用使得美國模式被嚴重的玷污了。

sentences.english: What the reporters offer as pure facts are actually descriptions with distortive interpretation.
sentences.chinese: 記者們提供的所謂純事實，其實是歪曲事實的敘述。

sentences.english: Did not ourselves the cubits warp, for fear to be a king.
sentences.chinese: 不正是我們自己歪曲了度量，不敢稱王稱霸。

sentences.english: Do you condone truth-twisting for entrepreneurs?
sentences.chinese: 你能寬恕企業家歪曲事實嗎？

sentences.english: He later accused reporters of wilful distortion and bias.
sentences.chinese: 他後來指責記者有意歪曲事實並帶有偏見。
然而歷史事實不容歪曲。

sentences.english: The report wrests the facts out of their true meaning.
sentences.chinese: 這篇報導歪曲了事實真相。

sentences.english: National security advisor Shivshankar Menon said that Joshi's remarks were misrepresented.
sentences.chinese: 國家安全顧問梅農稱喬希的評論被歪曲。

sentences.english: She garbled all the historical facts.
sentences.chinese: 她歪曲了所有歷史事實。

sentences.english: It’s as if these young men have developed a warped idea of manhood.
sentences.chinese: 似乎這些年輕小夥子們對男子漢氣概有歪曲的理解。

sentences.english: What are the two most common myths about rationality?
sentences.chinese: 對合理性的歪曲最常見的形式是哪兩種？

sentences.english: This skews the process down the line-and ultimately hurts students.
sentences.chinese: 這歪曲了的過程最終傷害了學生。

definition: to defame/to libel/to defile/to smear/to vilify
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
